name: Area
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Image
Context
Area
description:
Image::Context::Area

A Lat/long rectangle that specifies the location of the image.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/vision"

vision = Google::Cloud::Vision.new

image = vision.image "path/to/landmark.jpg"

image.context.area.min = { longitude: -122.0862462,
                           latitude: 37.4220041 }
image.context.area.max = { longitude: -122.0762462,
                           latitude: 37.4320041 }

entity = image.landmark

methods.name: min=
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Image
Context
Area#min=
methods.description: Sets the min lat/long pair for the area.

params.name: location
params.description: A Hash containing the keys :latitude and :longitude with corresponding values conforming to the WGS84 standard.

methods.name: max=
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Image
Context
Area#max=
methods.description: Sets the max lat/long pair for the area.

params.name: location
params.description: A Hash containing the keys :latitude and :longitude with corresponding values conforming to the WGS84 standard.

methods.name: empty?
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Image
Context
Area#empty?
methods.description: Returns true if either min or max are not populated.

methods.name: to_h
title: Google
Cloud
Vision
Image
Context
Area#to_h
methods.description: Deeply converts object to a hash. All keys will be symbolized.
